H0.text: who created the very first adhesive postage stamp and what year. 1840

H1.text: who created the very first adhesive postage stamp and what year. 1825

H2.text: who created the very first adhesive postage stamp and what year. 1850

H3.text: who created the very first adhesive postage stamp and what year. 1837

A4.text: It was first issued in the United Kingdom on 1 May 1840 but was not valid for use until 6 May.

A5.text: In 1837, British postal rates were high, complex and anomalous. To simplify matters, Sir Rowland Hill proposed an adhesive stamp to indicate pre-payment of postage.
